00027 #ifndef _FEATURE_VECTOR_H_
00028 #define _FEATURE_VECTOR_H_
00029 
00030 // Include STL binary predicates.
00031 #include <functional>
00032 
00042 template <typename T, const unsigned int D>
00043 struct feature_vector {
00044 
00046   T data[D];
00047 
00048   // Constructors.
00049   feature_vector() {} 
00050   feature_vector(T value) {
00051     for (unsigned int d=0; d<D; ++d)
00052       data[d] = value;
00053   } 
00054 
00055   // Subscript operators.
00056   const T & operator [] (unsigned int index) const { return data[index]; } 
00057   T & operator [] (unsigned int index) { return data[index]; } 
00058 
00059   // Comparison operators.
00060   bool operator == (const feature_vector &p) const; 
00061   bool operator != (const feature_vector &p) const; 
00062 
00063   // Squared distance operators for two D-dimensional points of type T.
00064   inline T distance_to(const feature_vector &p) const; 
00065   inline T distance_to(const feature_vector &p, T upper_bound) const; 
00066 
00067   // Memory operators: used to allow memory-aligned specializations. For example, for SSE optimizations.
00068   void *operator new [] (size_t size); 
00069   void  operator delete [] (void *p); 
00070 
00071 } __attribute__((packed));
00072 
00080 template <typename T>
00081 struct vector_distance : public std::binary_function <vector_distance<T>, vector_distance<T>, bool> {
00082 
00083   unsigned int index; 
00084   T squared_distance; 
00085 
00086   // Default and convenience constructors.
00087   vector_distance() {}
00088   vector_distance(unsigned int index, T squared_distance) : index(index), squared_distance(squared_distance) {}
00089 
00091   bool operator () (const vector_distance &v1, const vector_distance &v2) const {
00092     return v1.squared_distance < v2.squared_distance;
00093   }
00094 };
00095 
00096 // Template implementation.
00097 #include "feature_vector.cpp"

00099 #endif
